channel.title: How do you make alt commands in scar?
channel.description:
I want Scar to Press Alt+Q so it would trigger a function on a webpage.
Example: On Proboard's forums, if you press ALt+Q it sends you straight to the quick reply form.
Anyone know how to do that? Do I use keydown? Thanks if you can help.
~Ron

item.title: How do you make alt commands in scar?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Yeah I just want it to presss it when I start the script. Thanks for the help though. :)[br][size=1]Posted at: May 31, 2006, 05:27:23 pm[/size][hr]Also do you know how to minimize scar? Not hide it with getself.hide; but, just minimize it?

I’m trying to make a really good script lol.

~Ron

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make alt commands in scar?

item.title: How do you make alt commands in scar?
item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

You should check the question that guy asked about the ctrl key, I made something there…

nut here anyways:

program New;
begin
    while(TRUE) do
    begin
        if(IsFKeyDown(10)) then
        begin
            KeyDown(18);
            KeyDown(GetKeyCode('Q'));
            Wait(25);
            KeyUp(GetKeyCode('Q'));
            KeyUp(18);
            Wait(175);
        end;
    end;
end.

It presses it fairly slow, if you want it to press it more rapidly, change the 175 to some smaller number. It presses it when you press F10, you could change that to any time you want it too… but that is how you do it

edit:
KeyDown(17) = general ctrl
KeyDown(18) = general alt
KeyDown(20) = caps lock

i cant find what keyDown(19) is though…

Read full topic
